lines.text: It is difficult for anyone to speak when you listen only to yourself.
You read like an actor... and you drink like one. Would you take advice from the likes of me?
Ma'am, I take advice as easily as I take a drink. The only trouble with me is I've never been able to make good use of either.
The sleeping fox catches no poultry.
...now you're no longer sleeping. Open up! This is vital, a matter of life and death.
Some men leave goodwill. Others just a will.
There are even some that leave two wills.
Try to get the murder out of your face.
She's after my money. Everybody is after my money.
You must've been after it yourself to have acquired so much.
You know, it's the first of the month.
I can understand you excitement, it only comes once every thirty days.
And to show you I have indeed read the book, it says in Ecclesiastes "Money answereth all things".
In bitterness, Flaherty, it was said in bitterness!
That's the way I was asking for it.
